column4: Hey guys- I have a question about creating a bootable USB flash drive with the ubuntu 10.04 image from my mac.  I want to create the image on my mac, but boot my dell mini 9 with that usb drive.  I've tried following the directions on the ubuntu site at: http://www.ubuntulinux.org/netbook/get-ubuntu/download, but no matter what, it doesn't seem to be able to boot off the usb drive
Those directions make a USB drive which is only bootable on macs.
I suspected that might be the case... do you have any idea how to modify those instructions to create one that is bootable on a dell mini 9?
Are you set on Ubuntu 10.04? Because I already have an image which will work this way created for 64 bit Ubuntu 10.10.
I had read mixed reviews of Unity
but I haven't used either
and my machine is 32-bit
OK, I can create a minimal install iso for you that you can dd to a USB drive and boot from a BIOS based machine. What version of Ubuntu would you like?
and wouldn't I still have the problem getting the image onto a usb stick?
I was looking for the ubuntu netbook edition actually, is that very different from the standard?
The UI is signifigantly different, yes. The minimal installer can install any flavor of Ubuntu depending on what options you choose.
thank you
You're welcome.
http://216.57.70.194/ubuntu_minimal_lucid_i386_ddable.iso
getting a persmission error
Should be fixed now.
thanks! i'll give this a shot- so once it's downloaded I just need to do "sudo dd if=ubuntu_minimal_lucid_i386_ddable.iso of=/dev/rdisk4" ?
Yes.
sweet thanks a ton, i'll give that a shot
You're welcome.
downloaded!  before I dd it, do I need to format the drive with anything special?
No.
It's working! Thanks, I was going nuts. Ok I gotta log out of this machine cause I need the ethernet drop.  I'm gonna give this a shot.  Thanks a ton for all your help!
You're welcome :)
